intro: Pedicularis yezoensis var. pubescens, commonly known as the Yezo Snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, hairy pubescence, giving it a distinctive texture. This species is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
